intro: Endostemon ctenoneurus, commonly known as the curly-leaved endostemon, is a species of flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
